thread_title: LeadEngine Platform Pivot and Complete Build Specification

1_narrative.title: Narrative & Context
items: Session pivoted to prioritize building the LeadEngine Platform, an AI-powered conversion intelligence platform for estate agents and home goods stores.
Researched competitor RB2B, identified a gap in individual-level B2C identification, and conceived a full-funnel platform.
Built a complete 42-app-screen, 18-marketing-screen specification and saved it as a new project in the Build Factory.

2_objectives.title: Objectives
items: Build the LeadEngine Platform as the new #1 priority.
Achieve a 1-week build timeline and first client within 2 weeks.
Launch via a webinar model with £5,000/month pricing and limited availability.

3_success_criteria.title: Success Criteria
items: Platform built in 1 week.
First client onboarded within 2 weeks.
Webinar launch executed.

4_decisions.title: Decisions & Rules
items: NOT using RB2B API to avoid being cut out.
Building independently using IPinfo.io for company ID and Apollo for enrichment.
Pricing set at £5,000/month with limited spots and a webinar launch model.
Platform will be Docker-containerised for per-client deployment.
Using Chroma design system for marketing site and Brainwave for app dashboard.

5_sops.title: SOPs / Workflows
items: 7-day build sprint defined: Day 1-2 Foundation+AI, Day 3-4 Visitor+Capture, Day 5 Routing+Analytics, Day 6 Automation+Packaging, Day 7 Marketing+Launch.
Knowledge base ingestion via 5 methods: website scrape, file upload, Google Sheets sync, CRM API, webhook.
Update delivery via Watchtower for nightly Docker pulls and numbered idempotent migrations.
Multi-branch support via branch parameter in pixel and per-branch knowledge base in the same container.
Video production workflow using Remotion + Claude.

6_scripts.title: Scripts / Commands
items: Deploy script mentioned in DEPLOYMENT_SPEC.md.

7_inputs_outputs.title: Inputs & Outputs
items: Inputs: RB2B product/pricing/API teardown, competitor analysis of Chatwoot, Intercom, Drift, ImageKit.io analysis.
Outputs: COMPLETE_BUILD_SPEC.md, DESIGN_WORKBENCH_SPEC.md, VIDEO_PRODUCTION_SPEC.md, DEPLOYMENT_SPEC.md, session archive file.
Output includes kit-to-screen mapping for 42 app screens and 18 marketing screens.

8_missteps.title: Missteps / Errors / Risks
items: Identified risk: Using RB2B API could lead to them seeing the product and cutting out access.
Identified gap: Company-level ID (like RB2B) is insufficient for B2C contexts like estate agents who need individual inquiry identification.

10_status.title: Status
items: Planning and specification complete. Build scheduled to start Monday.

11_progress.title: Progress Markers
items: Complete product spec built and saved.
Competitor research and gap analysis completed.
Technology stack and build plan finalized.
Design workbench tasks scheduled for Sunday.

12_refinements.title: Refinements
items: Pivoted from using RB2B to building an independent, more comprehensive platform.
Decided to build own DAM instead of using ImageKit.io.
Refined AI model strategy to use Claude under the hood, branded as 'LeadEngine AI', with estimated £70-230/mo LLM cost per client.

13_dependencies.title: Dependencies
items: Dependencies: IPinfo.io API, Apollo API, Claude LLM, Fabric.js, Figma API, PostgreSQL, Docker, Watchtower.
Future work (Design Workbench, video production) depends on this specification.
Book concept material depends on this project's narrative.

14_entities.title: Entity Maps
items: LeadEngine Platform (AI conversion intelligence platform) -> Targets: Estate agents, Home goods stores.
Competitors: RB2B (visitor ID), Chatwoot, Intercom, Drift (live chat/conversational marketing).
Tech Stack: IPinfo.io (company ID), Apollo (enrichment), Claude (LLM), Chroma (marketing design), Brainwave (app design), Docker (containerization), Watchtower (updates), Remotion (video).
Build Factory: PRJ_LeadEngine_Platform project folder.
Knowledge Library: Session archive location.

15_glossary.title: Glossary
items: RB2B: A website visitor identification tool.
DAM: Digital Asset Management system.
RAG: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (AI technique).
LLM: Large Language Model.
Idempotent migrations: Database migrations that can be run multiple times safely.

Monday: Start of 7-day build sprint for LeadEngine Platform.
Future: Turn book concept (AI in property/proptech, 16-year founder story) into email sequences, LinkedIn content, webinar material.

Process includes comprehensive competitor teardown, independent build strategy, and detailed sprint planning.

VIDEO_PRODUCTION_SPEC.md: Spec including 171-term motion lexicon and storyboard template.

summary: The session pivoted to prioritize the LeadEngine Platform, a comprehensive AI conversion intelligence platform for estate agents, resulting in a complete build specification, competitor analysis, and a detailed 7-day build plan. Key decisions included building independently of competitors like RB2B and using a Docker-based, per-client deployment model. Outputs were systematically documented for immediate execution starting with the Design Workbench.
